meanings.definition: The quality or state of being measurable.
meanings.sent1: The measurabilities of the ingredients in the recipe helped me follow it accurately.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the measurabilities of data to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The alien was fascinated by Earth's measurabilities, especially the concept of time.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a measurability that touched everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the measurabilities of length using a ruler and a measuring tape.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be measured.
meanings.sent1: The measurabilities of the room allowed us to determine the size of the furniture we needed.
meanings.sent2: The measurabilities of the project's success were evident in the positive feedback from clients.
meanings.sent3: The detective was puzzled by the measurabilities of the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the task had a measurability that impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The measurabilities of the experiment were carefully recorded in the lab notebook.
